main event: An observer in Roanoke Rapids, North Carolina, reported seeing an object resembling a bright star or satellite for a duration of 25 minutes on February 21, 1952.
interesting points: The object was described as slightly dimmer than the North Star,Consistent with the characteristics of a satellite,The sighting was a ground visual observation,The observer reported seeing this object with two witnesses,The sighting is documented within Project Blue Book records.
witness description: The primary witness was a 35-year-old female with radio experience, along with her two daughters.
